metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13307 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Upstream kernel pci sysfs. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-69128924.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13307` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121').

linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
